channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for CA
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for CA

item.title: Report X-2023061338
item.description:
Report X-2023061338

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-07T18:12:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-03
  • City: BLOOMINGTON
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNION PACIFIC RAILROAD COMPANY INC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 3
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Yard crew reported liquid and a strong odor coming from CTCX 733390. Upon inspection of the car from the ground, the combination housing could be seen resting on the handle of the liquid line valve. The valve was in the open position. On top of the car we found the liquid line plug to be out of the valve body and confirmed the valve was in the open position. The valve was closed and the plug was installed and secured, stopping the release. The rest of the fittings on the car were also checked and found to be tight with no releases.

item.title: Report I-2023070001
item.description:
Report I-2023070001

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-07T18:12:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-28
  • City: LOS ANGELES
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: SINGAPORE AIRLINES CARGO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Upon dismantling of PMC17139SQ from SQ7988 - 28Jun2023, Cargo Warehouse Supervisor Mr. Oscar Castillo sighted that some of skids that belong to MAWB # 618-64200463 were showing signs of slight damage and plastic torn. He chose to raise a discrepancy and file a report due to crushed skids and ripped plastic. When opening the cargo to take photos of the inner boxes to look for damages and pilferage, he discovered the cargo contains undeclared DG for UN3480 in a large quantity. A report was subsequently sent to HQ, consignee informed via email that the said cargo is on HOLD pending further advise from SQ head office, as well as potential reporting of this incident to the local authorities. Nobody has been hurt and currently we have the cargo stored in our DG area. Shipment only arrived with a copy of the MAWB, no other documents were attached. Attempts to contact consignee has been made and no answer to phone / emails. Per MAWB the said shipment contains 8 skids (palletized) and said to contain 187 ctns Per MAWB they are declaring the goods to be Intercom Speaker (Non-DG) Per MAWB they also declaring these are LiBat in compliance with section II. (PI967).

  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was found by QA during the preload sort and declared damaged. Put inside hazmat liner and red tote to stop spilling. MSDS report obtained by shipper. SCMS was processed. Then taken to the hazmat processing cage and put inside a yellow bin. Total duration 1 hour. DescribePack: The bottles had loose caps and the contents spilled DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was immediately put inside a lined red hazmat tote container. Qualified QA personnel then processed the hazmat accordingly

Upon further investigation of the car, the manway was found with one loose manway swing bolt, an improperly installed nozzle gasket that was old and covered in product. The lid was resecured, and the release was stopped.

  • Description: On 05/20/2023 at approximately 1330, Dangerous Goods Admnistration received a call from Employee 916791 at the huib facility in Oakland, reporting a paint spill. This is an MPS of UN1263 PAINT that has spilled. 5 out of 8 of the packages have been compromised. TRK #s 574941090031, 574941090042, 574941090009, 574941090053, and 574941089998, have all completely spilled. Further inspection revealed that the inner containers were not securely sealed, nor was any absorbent material or cushioning present. The shipment is being held and awaits and amended shipper's declaration for further transport.

item.title: Report X-2023060015
item.description:
Report X-2023060015

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-07T18:12:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-05-21
  • City: SAN BERNARDINO
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: BNSF RAILWAY COMPANY
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On 05/21/23, the BNSF Los Angeles IMF reported YRCU 450262 (Waybill Hazardous) as dripping a clear like substance upon deramp and was immediately moved to the containment area. On behalf of the shipper, United Pumping was contacted and dispatched to complete the inspection and any necessary remediation. Inspection of the containment area revealed approximately one (1) quart of product lost outside of the unit while Interior inspection revealed a mixed load of palletized cargo including a secondary load supported by load bars. A 36X36 airbag was used for lateral securement although was found deflated while doorway securement was provided by a load strap and bullboard. The source of the leak was determined to be originating from four (4) car sized batteries found tipped on their sides releasing liquid. The source of the leak was determined as hazardous material UN 2794, contractor estimates the total loss to be under one (1) gallon before remediation took place. The cause of the leak was the result of failed packaging (stretch film) which was used in an attempt to unitize palletized batteries.

SES personnel overpacked the five (5) damaged pails in one (1) 55-gallon drum, then deployed absorbents to the released material. item.title: Report X-2023051345
item.description:
Report X-2023051345

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-07T18:12:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-05-08
  • City: LOS ANGELES
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: BNSF RAILWAY COMPANY
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On 5/08/2023, the BNSF Los Angeles hub reported Unit RNLU 100597 (Waybill Hazardous) (Sodium Hydroxide UN3266) leaking a substance from the rear of the container that did reach the ground. In the interest of safety the unit was moved to the containment area. On the behalf of the shipper, BNSF approved contractor United Pumping was contacted and dispatched to complete inspection and any necessary remediation. Interior inspection revealed palletized cases varying in size and IBC Totes 2 rows wide, the pallets were stacked multiple layers high throughout the container, Source of the leak was determined to be one IBC Tote containing Sodium Hydroxide mixture . The cause for the Leak was determined to be previous damage to the IBC Tote contributing to the material leak. Total quantity of leaked liquid was approximately 30 gallons of product. Impacted materials and surfaces were cleaned and neutralized. The damaged IBC Tote and soiled material was removed and will be disposed of by contractor in coordination with the Shipper (R&L Carriers). Disposal is pending.

  • Description: On May 8, 2023, two (2) 5-gallon pails containing UN2734 were crushed by a load shift and released approximately eight (8) ounces of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Ancon Services (AS) to remediate the site. AS personnel repalletized the undamaged pails and deployed absorbents to the release. The crew then utilized hand tools to collect all UN2734 impacted waste in one (1) 30-gallon drum for disposal.

  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal UAD experienced a UN3267 Wheelstrip 273WL release from a 55-gallon metal drum. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 0.5-gallons of product released to a 2' x 2' area of the dock floor due to bad a bad drum seam. Absorbents were utilized to clean the impacted area. The damaged drum was placed into a 95-gallon poly over pack. All cleanup debris was placed into a 55-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.description:
Report E-2023050345

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-07T18:12:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-05-12
  • City: Fresno
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ESTES WEST
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Patriot Environmental Services was dispatched to the site. Upon the contractors arrival, personnel observed that the released material impacted a 15ft- by-8ft area of the asphalt parking lot and a 20ft-by-8ft area of the trailer floor and estimated that approximately fifty (50) gallons of material was released from a 330-gallon poly tote due to improper preparation for transit. Patriot Environmental Services personnel stated that ESTES terminal personnel had deployed granular absorbents to the impacted asphalt prior to the contractors arrival. Patriot Environmental Services personnel deployed additional granular absorbents to the impacted trailer and gathered all spent absorbents and placed them into six (6) 55-gallon poly totes. The remaining product from the poly tote was transferred to five (5) 55-gallon poly drums. All waste was staged onsite at the terminal prior to the contractor demobilizing. The generated waste will remain onsite for the ESTES terminal team to coordinate disposal.
